data.title: Robert Wise Share On Facebook - Bonner Springs, Kansas
data.meta_description: Robert “Bob” E. Wise, age 82, of Basehor, Kansas passed away on Saturday, April 28, 2018 at his home while surround by his loving family.  The family will receive friends at a visitation from 6 to 8pm Tuesday, May 1st at the Maywood Community Church.  Funeral Service will be 10am Wednesday, May 2nd also at the Maywood Community Church with burial following in the Maywood Cemetery.  (Memorial Contributions can be made to the Maywood Community Church Cemetery) Bob was born on September 2, 1935 in Kansas City, Kansas and grew up in the Piper area.  He married Wilma Jean Haas on November 29, 1953 at Maywood Community Church.  Bob owned White Church Barbershop at 8420 Parallel for many years before it was taken to widen Parallel.  Bob could tell more stories about the barbershop than one can imagine.  There was always entertainment and cavorting going on.  Some stories were almost too crazy to believe, but they really did happen.  His customers jokingly referred to him as the Mayor of White Church. Many came in for the social happening, not always to get a haircut. When the road took the barbershop, he was forced to find other employment and went to work at Great Lakes Container Corporation eventually becoming a salesman in Kansas City.   He was promoted to General Manager and transferred to Tulsa, Oklahoma in the early 1980’s.  Bob served on the school board of Piper USD #203, the Wyandotte County Farm Bureau Board, Maywood Church Board, and was Treasurer of Piper City.  He was a 50 year member of the Delaware Masonic Lodge, and a member of the Maywood Community Church.  Bob was preceded in death by his Parents Charles and Eva Wise, Brothers, Charles Wise and Gary Wise.  He is survived by his wife, Wilma Jean Wise of the home, son, Mark Wise and wife Penny, of Basehor, Kansas, and daughter, Sheri Eberth and husband Dennis of Basehor, Kansas.  He is also survived by a sister, Doris Mogle of Basehor, Kansas.    Bob is survived by 4 grandchildren, Sarah Wise of Leavenworth, Mindy Cook and husband Josh of KCK,  Ryan Eberth of Basehor, Kansas and Lisa Freeburg and husband Darin of Blythwood, South Carolina. He is also survived by 3 great grandchildren, Brody and Jack Cook of KCK and Elsie Freeburg of South Carolina. The family would like to express their appreciation to Phoenix Hospice and their staff and Stephanie Pray for the excellent care provided to Bob during the last months of his life.
